text: Michael Jackson, the iconic pop singer and entertainer, passed away on June 25, 2009, at the age of 50. His death occurred at his home in Los Angeles, California, and was later ruled a homicide due to acute propofol and benzodiazepine intoxication. The circumstances surrounding his death led to significant media coverage and public mourning, as well as a trial and conviction of his personal physician, Dr. Conrad Murray, for involuntary manslaughter. Jackson was known as the "King of Pop" and had an immense influence on music, dance, and popular culture. His contributions to the music industry, particularly with groundbreaking albums like Thriller, Bad, and Dangerous, earned him numerous awards and accolades throughout his career. His innovative music videos and stage performances left a lasting legacy in entertainment.
title: Death of Michael Jackson
